reviews.review_msg: Known as one of the best CS profs at SFU, and I can see why. Marking is very fair, and assignments are relevant to the course content, although can be a little time consuming. Overall, a solid choice!

Goated prof. Answers all questions clearly and very accessible outside of class for help on material and assignments via piazza. Lectures can be a little dry due to the nature of the material going over formulas and their derivation. 4 tests, one every 3 weeks but open book/internet and pretty straight forward if you generally know all the content
Top G of a professor, he's probably the only good prof we have in the cs department. If we taught more classes I would take them.

An excellent professor that genuinely cares about his students. Held additional office hours on a holiday. Responded to an e-mail at 1 am in the morning. He's also extremely knowledgeable -- I don't recall a question he couldn't answer in depth. His quizzes are extremely easy for a 300 level course. Our class average was A-

Good prof, very responsive to questions, good lectures, useful slides, and lots of examples. Quizzes are not too bad, assignments were mostly reasonable, but having 2 group projects at the end of the term made it quite miserable to complete when you have 3 finals to study for. Tough class and prof but you learn a lot from him!

Text is excellent. Good lecturer. Lecture notes are so mathematical and not too usefull in  prep for exams. Tricky exam questions - was somewhat deceived by easy subject that turned difficult. Project can be difficult - so start early.
No tricky question.  Strict Forward Test Questions.  Just read the book and you'll go okay.  His lectures are very clear.  Work hard on assignments.
